alert.note: Alert for Coos; Curry; Douglas (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 02 at 5:30PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Flood Potential Outlook for quick rises on rivers and streams in the following counties in Oregon...Coos...Curry...Douglas... A series of atmospheric rivers will bring heavy rain to the coast and inland into Douglas County tonight through Sunday then again Tuesday into Wednesday. With the first system, rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are expected along the coast and into the coastal mountains through Sunday, with around 1 to 3 inches across Douglas County. Lighter rain is expected on Monday, followed by a second round of heavy rain Tuesday and Wednesday, with similar amounts as the first system. Heavy rain will result in rapid rises on areas streams and rivers. For the Coquille at Coquille, the South Fork of the Coquille at Myrtle Point and at Deer Creek at Roseburg there is a 30 percent chance for the rivers to rise to bankfull and a 5 to 10 percent chance for minor flooding, mainly as the second round of heavy rain arrives Tuesday and Wednesday. For the Chetco River, there is a 10 percent chance for the river to rise to bankfull and less than 5 percent chance for minor flooding by Wednesday. Additionally, ponding on area roadways, localized minor flooding in low lying or flood prone areas, and localized rockfalls or landslides are possible. A flood potential outlook is issued when there is the potential for significant rises or flooding along rivers and streams. The exact scenario for flooding remains uncertain. This product will be updated as necessary. Watches and warnings may be issued by the National Weather Service if this situation worsens.
